## ðŸ”§ Enhancement

### Summary
Improve error handling consistency and user experience across all application layers with standardized error responses and better logging.

### Current Issues
- Inconsistent error response formats
- Generic error messages exposed to users
- Insufficient error logging
- No global exception handling

### Proposed Improvements

#### API Layer
- [ ] Implement global exception middleware
- [ ] Create standardized error response models
- [ ] Add proper HTTP status code mapping
- [ ] Implement problem details (RFC 7807) standard

#### Application Layer
- [ ] Create custom exception types
- [ ] Implement result pattern for better error handling
- [ ] Add validation error aggregation
- [ ] Improve MediatR pipeline error handling

#### Infrastructure Layer
- [ ] Add database connection error handling
- [ ] Implement retry policies for external services
- [ ] Add structured logging for errors
- [ ] Create correlation IDs for request tracking

#### Domain Layer
- [ ] Define domain-specific exceptions
- [ ] Implement business rule validation errors
- [ ] Add invariant checking

### Technical Implementation

#### Error Response Model
```json
{
  "type": "https://example.com/errors/validation",
  "title": "Validation Error",
  "status": 400,
  "detail": "One or more validation errors occurred",
  "instance": "/api/students",
  "traceId": "12345",
  "errors": {
    "Email": ["Email format is invalid"]
  }
}
```

#### Logging Improvements
- Use structured logging with Serilog
- Include correlation IDs
- Log error context and stack traces
- Implement different log levels appropriately

### Benefits
- Better user experience with clear error messages
- Easier debugging and troubleshooting
- Consistent error handling across application
- Improved monitoring and alerting capabilities

### Testing
- [ ] Unit tests for exception handling
- [ ] Integration tests for error scenarios
- [ ] Error response validation

### Priority
High - Critical for production readiness
